attachments.text: I don't know if there are any plans to repeat <http://r-iisa2019.rbind.io/|R@IISA> at <https://www.intindstat.org/meetings|IISA2022> which is planned to be in Bangalore, India, presumably at a a similar time of year to previous instances (last few days of December). If another R@IISA is held, it could be good to connect with this conference in a similar way to the plans for LatinR 2021 (<https://github.com/forwards/rcontribution/issues/9|#9>). This is some way off, but might need a bit of planning ahead, so I'm noting it for future consideration.
attachments.title: <https://github.com/forwards/rcontribution/issues/13|#13 R Contribution Working Group at R@IISA?>

attachments.text:
We need to improve communications so that people know what we're up to

☐ Set up Twitter account to advertise RCWG meetings and events
☐ Get <https://forwards.github.io/rcontribution/|https://forwards.github.io/rcontribution/> linked from main R-project site. Get official subdomain?
☐ Embed Google calendar of meetings and events on website, so easier for people from outside to join
☐ Proper mailing list so people can subscribe/unsubscribe to event/other announcements
☐ Add link to R Dev Guide on website
☐ Add workshops page with links to videos of useR! tutorials and associated materials

Also (not a checklist because recurring tasks)

• Advertise RCWG meetings on R-devel Slack and R-devel mailing list
• Report highlights of RCWG meetings on R Weekly (as we currently do on R-Ladies and MiR Slack)
attachments.title: <https://github.com/forwards/rcontribution/issues/14|#14 Improve RCWG communications>
